intro: Leptacanthus alatus, commonly known as the winged bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which aid in buoyancy in water. The plant is typically found in shallow, still waters such as ponds and wetlands. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Leptacanthus alatus is a carnivorous plant, capable of trapping and digesting small aquatic organisms to supplement its nutrient intake.
